intro: Fagara claessensii, commonly known as the Caribbean mountain pepper, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. Fagara claessensii is often found in moist, shaded habitats within mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native ecosystems.
